item.description: Biography I am an Assistant Professor in the Department of Information Science at the Ann S. Bowers College of Computing and Information Science at Cornell University. My research investigates how emerging information technologies reshape economic systems and influence social behavior, combining large-scale empirical analysis and experimental methods to connect the design of digital systems with their real-world consequences. My ongoing work focuses on timely issues in the digital economy, including studies on privacy regulations, the economics of online platforms, and the multi-faceted consequences of data-driven technologies and AI.
